XMVP.Story: { "title": "The Ladypillers", "synopsis": "A ragtag group of inept criminals attempts to fleece a sweet but eccentric old lady who runs a competitive worm farm, only to be outsmarted by her surprisingly aggressive chihuahua.", "characters": [ "Sheriff Winerstein", "Mrs. Chumson", "Mackenzie Funtime", "Lil' Mack", "O'Hare", "Saucier Wormatorium" ], "theme": "Satire" }
XMVP.Manifest:
{ "segs": [ { "id": 1, "start_frame": 0, "end_frame": 0, "prompt": "Scene 1 from The Ladypillers", "action": "comedy", "script_content": "{
 "title": "The Ladypillers",
 "scene": {
 "scene_number": 1,
 "setting": "A BOAT. Specifically, a bathtub toy bobbing in a kiddie pool filled with questionable green slime.",
 "action": "We see it from GOD'S PERSPECTIVE, barely making headway against the powerful currents generated by a rogue pool noodle. Absurdly EPIC credits play over SLOW-MOTION shots of the bathtub toy. The soundtrack is a full-blown Wagnerian opera, wildly inappropriate for a plastic boat. The 'splash' sound effect is clearly someone smacking their lips. The boat careens wildly after encountering a rubber ducky, then crashes majestically into a plastic castle. Cut. Credit sequence ends abruptly.",
 "character": "AN EXTREMELY LAZY CHIHUAHUA",
 "action": "Lies sprawled on a sun-faded, astroturf-covered porch, snoring like a tiny chainsaw. The porch is adorned with plastic flamingos and a gnome fishing in a birdbath. The only sounds are the buzzing of a single, persistent fly and, faintly, the sound of a kazoo band practicing 'Amazing Grace' several blocks away. A bicycle horn, inexplicably loud, blares from somewhere nearby. The chihuahua twitches its nose, sniffs dramatically, then pulls a tiny blanket over its head and resumes snoring. We ZOOM IN to reveal that the chihuahua is positioned directly in front of...",
 "scene_element": "SAUCIER WORM-A-RAMA (formerly 'Wormatorium')",
 "action": "Your source for worms, lures, and extremely judgmental earthworm commentary! We PAN OVER to show that the ramshackle building also houses the...",
 "scene_element": "SAUCIER MUNICIPAL MISUNDERSTANDING (formerly 'Building')",
 "action": "A campaign poster in the window features SHERIFF WINERSTEIN, looking suspiciously like a ventriloquist dummy, giving a thumbs-up and sporting a slogan: 'RE-ELECT WAYNE WINERSTEIN/He's Only Mostly Dead!'.",
 "action": "We hear snoring punctuated by a bubbling sound. We APPROACH the open jail cell door. Inside, the cell is meticulously decorated with doilies and a 'Hang in There' kitten poster. A fish tank gurgles merrily.",
 "scene_element": "A comically oversized KEY",
 "action": "We CIRCLE around the jailer's key, dangling precariously from a single, frayed thread. The snoring and bubbling intensify. A close-up reveals a family of dust bunnies living in the corner, watching the key with vague interest.",
 "scene_element": "POLICE SCANNER (circa 1978)",
 "action": "We ZOOM IN on the scanner. The bubbling noise becomes deafening. The only sound is the static hiss of an open channel, occasionally interrupted by a commercial for 'Bob's Bait and Bargain Basement'. The snoring is louder here. We PAN OFF the scanner and ONTO a pair of FEET clad in fuzzy bunny slippers, propped up on the desk. They belong to SHERIFF WINERSTEIN, who is tilted back in his chair, wearing a sleep mask on his forehead, and snoring loud enough to power a small wind turbine. Just as the camera reaches him, a rotary dial TELEPHONE rings -- muffled, as if calling from inside a sock drawer. He wakes with a start, nearly launching himself into the ceiling fan, and grabs the phone.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Sheriff... Winerstein... (The muffled ringing continues. He stares at the phone with utter confusion.) What in tarnation is going on?",
 "character": "VOICE (O.S.)",
 "dialogue": "(Muffled, from next door) Worms! Extra juicy, guaranteed to attract even the pickiest bass!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "(Hangs up the phone, sighs theatrically) Back to beauty sleep. (The front door bursts open with the force of a small explosion. He leaps out of his chair, clutching his chest in mock terror, then forces a smile.) Afternoon, Miz Chumson.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "(Enters wearing a floral muumuu, a bedazzled sun visor, and carrying a purse shaped like a watermelon) Afternoon, Sheriff. You know that Mackenzie Funtime fella?",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "(Feigning ignorance) ...Mackenzie Funtime? Never heard of him. Must be one of them 'new' people.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "No, no, Lil' Mack! Mackatee's eldest! Got a collection of bottle caps to rival the Smithsonian!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Oh, that hooligan! Yes, I believe I do. Always causing shenanigans.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Well, he done gone down to the Buc-ee's in Luling, got hisself a boombox the size of a small car, and he been blastin' that music! Winerstein looks genuinely confused.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Uh-huh... And this affects me how?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Loud! It's louder than a gaggle of geese in a tin barn!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Well--",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "'Ice Ice Baby'! On repeat! Non-stop!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "He--",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Songs like that! About frozen dairy desserts!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Uh-huh...",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Vanilla-flavored nuisance music!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "I could--",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "You know, they call it vanilla-flavored nuisance music, but it don't make me wanna lick any ice cream!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "No ma'am--",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "And O'Hare don't like that music neither! Sheriff Winerstein's forced smile threatens to crack his face in half.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "It's been disturbin' O'Hare then, has it? (He pats her hand with exaggerated concern.) Is it affecting his napping schedule?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "How could it not! That kind of confectionary-themed noise! You know what they call colored folks in them songs? You wouldn't believe the horrors!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "I don't think I--",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "SNICKERDOODLES! I don't wanna say the word. I won't say it twice, I'll tell you that. I say it one time. It's a national tragedy!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Yes ma'am.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "In the course a swearin' out my complaint. And it's gonna be a strongly worded one, let me tell you!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Yes'm--",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "SNICKERDOODLES! Two thousand years after sliced bread! Thirty years after the Macarena craze! Sweet merciful heavens, is this really happening?",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Mm-mm--",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Lil' Mack down to the Buc-ee's buyin' a gargantuan sound-blasting contraption?! So he can listen to that word in the house next to mine? Sheriff, you gotta confiscate that infernal machine!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Confiscate it?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "You gotta take an innarest! Impound that sound system, dismantle it, use the parts to build a birdhouse! Make that boy do community service picking up litter with one of those grabber things!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Well, we're here to help... (He winks at an imaginary camera.) We're basically the A-Team, but with fewer explosions and more paperwork.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Well God bless ya. Don't wanna be tried and found wantin'. Just get rid of the music before O'Hare starts communicating through interpretive dance!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "No ma'am.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Many many twinkledum parzen, Sheriff Winerstein. Many many twinkledum parzen!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Many what ma'am? Are those some kinda fancy cookies?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "You have been weighed, you have been measured, and you have been found... lacking in sugar! Don't want that writin' on the wall, spelled out in frosting!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "No ma'am--",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Feast a Balthazar! With extra sprinkles!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Mm-hm.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "John The Apostle said: Behold! There is a stranger in our midst, come to replace all our furniture with inflatable versions!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Yes ma'am.",
 "action": "Mrs. Chumson exits, humming a jaunty tune and waving her watermelon purse.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "(Muttering) He's a good man. Just needs a serious sugar rush. (She kicks a plastic flamingo out of her path.) Dog, you in peoples' way.",
 "action": "The chihuahua stirs, yawns dramatically, and shuffles off to nap in a sunbeam.",
 "setting": "EXT. MRS. CHUMSON'S HOUSE - DAY",
 "action": "With a collection of garden gnomes so extensive it borders on obsessive. It is the last house on a street of identical pastel-colored houses; beyond it, the street ends abruptly at a giant inflatable bouncy castle. Beyond the bouncy castle, one can faintly make out a giant, gaudily decorated TRAMPOLINE anchored to the riverbank. Mrs. Chumson enters her yard. She stops to adjust the position of a garden gnome holding a tiny fishing rod.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "(To the gnome) Now you stay put, Bartholomew. You're the only thing keepin' the squirrels from breakin' into the bird feeder.",
 "action": "Mrs. Chumson lets herself in. A CAT, wearing a tiny crown and a sparkly collar, struts up to her, meowing imperiously.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "You need somethin' to eat, Princess Fluffybutt?",
 "action": "Mrs. Chumson wrestles with an electric can opener to open a can of cat food.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Mm... tuna in aspic... Your favorite, your highness.",
 "action": "The cat circles her ankles, purring like a broken lawnmower, anticipating the culinary delights. The can contains glistening cubes of processed tuna suspended in a gelatinous substance that looks suspiciously like hair gel.",
 "setting": "INT. MRS. CHUMSON'S LIVING ROOM - DAY",
 "action": "Above the fireplace hangs a velvet painting of a man with a handlebar mustache and an Elvis-esque sideburns. A disco ball hangs precariously from the ceiling, casting a rainbow of light across the room. Mrs. Chumson enters and dramatically poses in front of the painting, striking a runway pose.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "O'Hare, I done complained about Lil' Mack. I hope it'll do some good. That boy is walking a razor's edge, teetering on the brink of good manners! 'Ice Ice Baby'! She does a little shuffle dance. Over the fiery pit of bad taste! She flicks a handful of glitter into the air and sits in a rocking chair, pulling out her knitting. As she sits, she lets out a dramatic groan. Sixty-seven years of life, forty-six years of marriage, and you mean to tell me you never once suffered from a hangnail? It's the human condition! Like that philosopher said: 'Life's got two kinds of folks -- them that's got hangnails and them that's gonna get 'em.' But you were always healthy as a horse... (There is the distant sound of a kazoo playing 'Taps'.) ...Passed on before you got a hangnail. Mmmmhmm. Thank the Lord you weren't sick. You don't wanna sicken 'n die. No, you wanna pass nice 'n peaceful... go to sleep one night, wake up surrounded by unicorns and rainbows... woof... (A gust of wind rattles the wind chimes. The disco ball spins faster, casting more frantic light around the room.) As Mrs. Chumson looks around the room, feeling a sudden sense of foreboding, the cat arches its back and hisses. At this moment, the doorbell rings. Well who's that now, Pickles? Oh wait, I named you Princess Fluffybutt. My bad! (She heaves herself out of the chair with a groan.)",
 "action": "She opens the door-- A gust of wind-- The disco ball falls from the ceiling, showering the room in shards of sparkly plastic. The cat shrieks and bolts out the door, past the man on the stoop: GOLDTHWAIT HIGGINSON DORR, III. He is dressed in a full pirate costume, complete with a feathered hat and a plastic parrot on his shoulder. He has clearly not slept in several days. The smile he attempts is more of a grimace.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "PRINCESS FLUFFYBUTT! (She chases after the cat, waving her arms wildly.)",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Arr?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Don't just stand there like a landlubber! Go get her! She's got a hankering for the neighbor's prize-winning goldfish!",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Madam, I fail to comprehend the urgency of this... feline pursuit.",
 "action": "Dorr awkwardly chases after the cat, tripping over his own peg leg. Mrs. Chumson yells encouragement from the porch.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "She's headed for the azalea bush! That's where she hides the evidence! You gotta stop her before she buries the goldfish head!",
 "action": "Dorr dives into the azalea bush, emerging covered in leaves and with a live goldfish flopping in his mouth.",
 "scene_element": "O'Hare's velvet painting, hanging at a jaunty angle, seems to be silently judging the chaos.",
 "action": "An OBJECTIVE ANGLE shows Dorr lying on the couch, spitting out goldfish and clutching a bag of frozen peas to his head. Mrs. Chumson enters with a cup of suspiciously green tea.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Madam, I am eternally indebted to your... hospitality.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Well, you did try to eat my cat's goldfish. That kinda evens things out.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Allow me to formally introduce myself. I am Goldthwait Higginson Dorr, Ph.D. Pirate. (He strikes a dramatic pose.)",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "What, like a doctor of pirate-ology? Do they even have that?",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "It's a mark of academic... commitment. A degree bestowed upon those who have mastered the ancient art of... swashbuckling. I also have a certificate in advanced parrot training from the Parrot Institute of the Caribbean.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "(Chuckles) Parrot training, huh? You ever train 'em to say 'Polly want a cracker'? That's always a crowd-pleaser.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "I have not had that... privilege.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "It's a skill. Takes dedication. I send five dollars a month to the 'Polly Want a Cracker' Foundation.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "That's very... generous.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "I'm on their mailing list. I'm a Parrot Angel.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Indeed.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "They mention my name in the newsletter. I got the latest issue right here. You wanna see it? (She rummages through her watermelon purse.)",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Perhaps when my head has recovered from its... goldfish-related trauma. Mrs. Chumson, are you at all intrigued by the purpose of my visit to your... vibrant abode?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "I was wonderin', until you started reenacting 'Pirates of the Caribbean' in my azalea bush. Then, I just got confused.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "I quite understand. I happened to notice the sign in your window proclaiming the availability of lodgings, and I was immediately captivated by the... unique charm of your residence.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Yeah, I got a room. I'm lookin' for a tenant who doesn't attract flocks of pigeons or summon ancient sea monsters. Fifteen dollars a week, and you gotta promise not to sacrifice any goats in the bathtub.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "I quite understand. Madam, you are speaking to a man who values peace and quiet... except for the occasional sea shanty. Perhaps you could show me the room, and I can elaborate on my... peculiar situation?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Well, you can see the room, but I don't like no shenanigans. If you start talkin' about buried treasure, I'm calling the sheriff.",
 "action": "Mrs. Chumson leads the way upstairs.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "You see, madam, I am currently on sabbatical from the Institute of Pirate Studies. I am taking a year off to indulge my passion for... historical reenactment. I am the captain of a crew of historical reenactors, performing at Renaissance fairs and... pirate-themed birthday parties...",
 "action": "They enter a small bedroom. There is a bunk bed covered in pirate flags, a treasure chest overflowing with plastic doubloons, and a poster of Johnny Depp as Captain Jack Sparrow. Dorr gazes around with awe.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "...thoo-out central and southern Mississippi. We perform... scenes from 'Treasure Island' and 'Blackbeard's Revenge', aiming for historical accuracy, though we occasionally take... creative liberties. Why, this is... surprisingly thematic.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Wait a minute. You got some kind of band?",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "The word 'band' is... inaccurate. We are a motley crew of swashbucklers, dedicated to the art of historical... interpretation. We sing sea shanties, engage in mock sword fights, and occasionally launch water balloons filled with grog.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "So you don't play vanilla-flavored nuisance music, or songs about lost wallets and frozen desserts?",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Madam, the mere thought sends shivers down my timbers! My aversion to modern music and all forms of contemporary... degeneracy is... profound. We play music from a time when men were men, parrots were parrots, and the only ice cream was served on the poop deck.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Gospel music?",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Inspired by the gospels of... rum, plunder, and buried treasure. The vintage is... decidedly older than the Rococo.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Rococo, huh? Well, I guess that'd be okay. So long as you don't start swingin' from the chandeliers with a cutlass.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "I certainly don't propose to inflict our... rehearsals on you. May I ask -- do you possess a cellar of any kind?",
 "action": "Dorr ducks precariously while descending the narrow, creaky stairs, followed by Mrs. Chumson.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Yes, yes, yes, this has potential... (He pulls a string to reveal a single flickering lightbulb, illuminating a dusty, cobweb-filled cellar.)",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "A little damp, ain't it? And full of spiders bigger than my head.",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Oh, indeed! But that only enhances the acoustics! (He claps his hands and the sound echoes dramatically.) Marvelous! These earthen walls are ideal for... creating the atmosphere of a pirate cove! That's why so much pirate music was played in caves and grottos. Yes, this will do nicely... (He rubs his hands together with manic glee, his parrot squawking in agreement.) This is... adequate. I can barely contain my... mild satisfaction.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "You containin' it just fine. (He starts peeling cash from a massive roll of bills.)",
 "character": "DORR",
 "dialogue": "Allow me to pay you a week in advance! Allow me to pay you two weeks in advance! Allow me to pay you a month in advance! I cannot bear the thought of these... accommodations being occupied by someone who doesn't appreciate their... nautical ambiance!",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "That would be a crying shame. Especially since I already bought the parrot-themed wallpaper.",
 "setting": "TRACKING ON A GARBAGE CART - CASINO - DAY",
 "action": "On the cart, a boombox blasts polka music. The cart is being pushed through a casino filled with mannequins dressed in sequined gowns. As the cart stops, someone shouts:",
 "character": "VOICE (V.O.)",
 "dialogue": "Watch out for the sequins! They get everywhere!",
 "action": "WIDER - Shows two young men in ridiculous oversized uniforms, with janitorial supplies strapped to their bodies. LIL' MACK- Mackenzie Funtime - is giving instructions to GAWAIN MACSAM.",
 "character": "LIL' MACK",
 "dialogue": "You wouldn't believe the stuff people leave behind in this place. False teeth, toupees, sometimes even a live iguana! You gotta be prepared for anything.",
 "character": "GAWAIN",
 "dialogue": "I ain't touchin' no iguana, man! Those things bite! And they got those creepy little eyes!",
 "action": "As they roll on, we see more of the casino, which is decorated with inflatable palm trees and a giant disco ball. Dealers in clown makeup are stacking oversized poker chips, pit bosses in top hats are reviewing spreadsheets.",
 "character": "LIL' MACK",
 "dialogue": "You gotta do it! Mr. Gudge sees everything. That man is a cyborg, I swear. (Looking around furtively) Look at this! (He plucks a giant poker chip from a wastebasket and slips it into his pocket.) Keep an eye out, man! I found a rubber chicken once worth five hundred dollars!",
 "character": "GAWAIN",
 "dialogue": "Five hundred dollars for a rubber chicken? What kind of casino is this?",
 "character": "LIL' MACK",
 "dialogue": "It was a collector's item! Signed by Elvis's parrot! (He checks the label of a discarded bottle of hairspray) Always remember to check the contents before throwing it in the garbage. You never know what treasures you might find.",
 "character": "GAWAIN",
 "dialogue": "Man, my fingers gonna turn to green goo if I keep touchin' this stuff!",
 "setting": "SERVICE HALL - CASINO - DAY",
 "action": "The cart squeaks loudly on the plastic tile floor.",
 "character": "LIL' MACK",
 "dialogue": "This tunnel leads to the break room. To the office for all the people work for... Gudge Industries! Owns the Lady Luck 'n three other barges... (He stops to empty a wastebasket filled with banana peels.) The lights is ugly, but at least it's not filled with live eels. (He bangs on a steel door.) YO, cyborg! Open up!",
 "character": "MUFFLED VOICE (O.S.)",
 "dialogue": "Who goes there, seeking access to the inner sanctum of financial wizardry?",
 "character": "LIL' MACK",
 "dialogue": "It's me, Lil' Mack! Now open the darn door before I start singin' 'Ice Ice Baby' at the top of my lungs!",
 "action": "We hear a booming laugh and the steel-reinforced door swings open.",
 "action": "The two men enter, Lil' Mack nodding at the security man (ELRON).",
 "character": "LIL' MACK",
 "dialogue": "This is where they count the dough. You try to take any of it, Elron there shoot you with a confetti cannon. (The security man chuckles.) This place is a disaster zone! (He picks up some uneaten corn dogs.) You a pig, man! Nothin' but a squeaky ol' mother-scratchin' pig! (Elron uses one hand to wipe corn dog crumbs off his uniform.) You got ketchup stains on your nametag, man! You still eatin' breakfast when you supposed to be eatin' lunch! You a disgrace before... oh, hello Mr. Gudge! How we stealin', killin' and plunderin' this mornin'?",
 "action": "A man in a buttoned white shirt nods at him.",
 "character": "GUDGE",
 "dialogue": "Funthes. How's the new man?",
 "character": "LIL' MACK",
 "dialogue": "He is a cleanin' mother-shuckin' tornado, man!",
 "character": "GUDGE",
 "dialogue": "Is that a fact?",
 "setting": "HIGH ANGLE - A RUINED FIELD - DAY",
 "action": "It is a field covered in rubber chickens and discarded clown wigs. Charred palm trees reach toward the sky. Smoke drifts across the desolate landscape. Something is bouncing towards us from the deep background. We BOOM DOWN as it approaches: a POODLE, running enthusiastically on its ridiculous little legs.",
 "character": "PANCAKE (O.S.)",
 "dialogue": "Go, Fluffybutt! Go get 'em!",
 "action": "There is a small explosion that showers glitter in front of the dog. It veers off course. Something ridiculous is strapped to the dog's neck - a tiny disco ball that bounces as it runs.",
 "end_scene": true

}" }, { "id": 2, "start_frame": 0, "end_frame": 0, "prompt": "Scene 2 from The Ladypillers", "action": "comedy", "script_content": "{

 "Suddenly, out of the ether, a discombobulated basset hound rockets into frame, wearing a tiny construction hardhat and an inexplicably tiny tool belt. It begins furiously digging, kicking up dust and confusion.",

 "A cartoonish **BOOM**, echoing like a rejected Looney Tunes sound effect, sends the marshmallow-covered duo tumbling down a conveniently located Slip 'N Slide.",
 "They land with a resounding **PLOP** right in front of the basset hound, who is now enthusiastically devouring kibble from a gaudy, rhinestone-studded dog bowl. Emblazoned on the bowl in glitter glue: \"PRINCESS FLUFFERNUTTER'S SNACKIES.\"",
 "From offscreen, a voice dripping with exasperated sarcasm:"
 ],
 "character": "O'HARE (O.S.)",
 "dialogue": "Cut! For Sassprilla's sake, did Princess Fluffernutter's tiara fall off AGAIN? This is amateur hour, people!",
 "action": [

 "**CUT UP TO:** **O'Hare**, who looks like a disgruntled garden gnome in a director's chair. He glares down at the dog with the intensity of a thousand suns."
 ],
 "character": "O'HARE",
 "dialogue": "Props! STAT! Before I lose my ever-loving mind!",

 "dialogue": "Alrighty then! Time to deposit these bad boys in the 'ol hearse-mobile! Hope nobody notices the faint scent of maple syrup... and desperation.",
 "action": "He wobbles down the rickety steps, nearly losing his balance. The front door creaks open, revealing SHERIFF WINERSTEIN, MRS. CHUMSON, and MACKENZIE FUNTIME, all looking like they've seen better (and less sticky) days.",
 "action": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN, scratching his head with a donut, shuffles towards a suspiciously trombone-shaped case.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Well, I'll be hornswoggled! What in tarnation could be tickin' inside this here contraption?",
 "action": "He fumbles with the latches, which promptly explode open, showering him with... magazines. Old copies of \"Cat Fancy.\"",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Great Sassprilla, it's a dang library of fluffballs! What is this, some kind of feline-themed extortion racket?",
 "action": "MRS. CHUMSON and MACKENZIE FUNTIME stumble down the stairs, bumping into each other like a pair of confused penguins.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Sheriff! Did you find my dentures? I swear, they hopped right out of my glass last night!",
 "setting": "EXT. STREET - DAY",
 "action": "SAUCIER WORMATORIUM is now being actively DRAGGED down the street by the weight of the bowling ball bags. He resembles a dachshund on a leash being walked by a particularly enthusiastic toddler.",
 "action": "HIS POV - A beat-up ice cream truck, painted an unsettling shade of Pepto-Bismol pink, idles ominously down the block.",
 "action": "CLOSE ON - The truck's side-view mirror. A figure leans out, peering into the mirror. It's LIL' MACK, sporting pigtails and a disturbingly blank expression.",
 "action": "LIL' MACK's POV - SAUCIER WORMATORIUM, looking like he's about to have a very public meltdown, lurches closer.",
 "character": "SAUCIER WORMATORIUM",
 "dialogue": "(Strained) No extra sprinkles, huh? You said no extra sprinkles! This is an outrage!",
 "action": "He stops dead in his tracks, clutching his chest dramatically.",
 "character": "SAUCIER WORMATORIUM",
 "dialogue": "Nnnrnf! I think I'm having a gluten attack! Or maybe it's just the existential dread of working for minimum wage.",
 "action": "O'HARE, dressed in a full General Patton costume, sprints into the street, his helmet askew.",
 "character": "SAUCIER WORMATORIUM",
 "dialogue": "Oof! My sciatica!",
 "action": "SAUCIER WORMATORIUM shakes his head, muttering about the perils of gig economy employment, and continues his waddle towards the truck.",
 "action": "HIS POV - The Pepto-Bismol truck looms closer.",
 "action": "The TRUCK - LIL' MACK waits, tapping her foot impatiently. The back doors swing open with a clang, and SAUCIER WORMATORIUM's voice echoes.",
 "character": "SAUCIER WORMATORIUM",
 "dialogue": "Mountain Dew... I mean, Lil' Mack!",
 "character": "LIL' MACK",
 "dialogue": "Chop-chop, Buttercup! We ain't got all day. The penguins are waiting for their popsicles.",
 "action": "SAUCIER WORMATORIUM strains and groans as he heaves the bowling ball bags into the back.",
 "character": "SAUCIER WORMATORIUM",
 "dialogue": "Nnrungh! Aaarmh... Ninnnff... Offffflleghhll! I need a raise... and a chiropractor.",
 "character": "LIL' MACK",
 "dialogue": "Hemorrhoids, dear? You should try Preparation H. It's a miracle worker.",
 "action": "CUT TO - The BACK OF THE TRUCK. SAUCIER WORMATORIUM is being garroted with a jump rope by O'HARE, who's humming the theme song to \"The Benny Hill Show.\"",
 "character": "SAUCIER WORMATORIUM",
 "dialogue": "Nnnnnmmmmfffgh! I knew I should've invested in life insurance!",
 "setting": "EXT. BRIDGE - NIGHT",
 "action": "A grotesque gargoyle, resembling a disgruntled accountant, stares down from the bridge. O'HARE and MACKENZIE FUNTIME stand guard, each holding a foot clad in oversized clown shoes. MRS. CHUMSON leans against the railing, gazing wistfully into the night.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "\"...Like those Nicean dinghies of yesteryear That wobbled, o'er a puddle of stale beer...\"",
 "action": "The faint honk of a passing duck boat is heard.",
 "action": "O'HARE and MACKENZIE FUNTIME hoist the bowling ball bag over the railing. Inside of it is Saucer Wormatorium.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "\"...The tipsy, tango-dancing tourist bore...\"",
 "action": "They drop the bag.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "\"...To his own Hawaiian shirt galore.\"",
 "action": "A distant 'sploosh' is heard, followed by the cawing of seagulls arguing over the leftovers.",
 "action": "CLOSE ON - A FIST clutching three oversized lollipop sticks. MACKENZIE FUNTIME picks a long stick and smiles with relief. O'HARE pulls a short stick and grunts in annoyance.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Excellent! I believe, at last, we have the right stooge for the next round of bingo!",
 "setting": "INT. MRS. CHUMSON'S BEDROOM - NIGHT",
 "action": "MRS. CHUMSON lies on her back, snoring like a walrus with a head cold. At the open window, her collection of Beanie Babies dances in the evening breeze. A novelty clock ticks ominously on the mantel. It reads 12:59 AM.",
 "action": "The CELLAR DOOR creaks open. O'HARE peeks out, puffing nervously on a comically oversized cigar. He pushes the door open and emerges.",
 "action": "Mrs. Chumson's snore catches on an inhale. She mumbles something about needing more prune juice and resumes snoring.",
 "action": "O'HARE tiptoes up the stairs, pulling a rubber chicken from his jacket. With a dramatic flourish, he swings it in a complicated loop and snags the other end with his other hand. He emerges from the staircase and approaches the bedroom door. As he reaches for the knob, he attempts a no-handed flip of the burning cigar into his mouth. It lands squarely in his left nostril.",
 "action": "The door swings open. O'HARE pauses to survey the room: the ticking clock, Mrs. Chumson snoring like a freight train. He advances, raising the rubber chicken. He closes on her sleeping form. The rubber chicken is lowered towards her exposed neck. It's a foot away... half a foot... inches...",
 "action": "Somewhere, a miniature orchestra tunes up and the clock STRIKES ONE. Instead of a cuckoo, a miniature Liberace emerges, playing a tiny piano. A disco ball descends from the clock's interior, bathing the room in glitter.",
 "action": "O'HARE freezes, his eyes widening in terror. He has swallowed his cigar. He claws at his throat, panicking. In a silent frenzy, he yanks loose his ascot and grabs the water glass from Mrs. Chumson's bedside. He tips it back.",
 "action": "HIS POV - The uptilted water glass reveals a set of dentures – complete with tiny, gold-plated molars – sliding towards his face.",
 "action": "O'HARE frantically sets the glass back down. He looks wildly about, one hand clamped to his throat. A mad dash for the door ensues.",
 "action": "He plunges for the head of the stairs—a brief squawk from the parrot—recoiling from where its tail has been stepped on, it unleashes a torrent of obscenities at O'HARE's leg—and he tumbles down the stairs, each impact producing a cartoonish 'boing' sound.",
 "action": "He lies still at the bottom, his head bent at an unnatural angle. Smoke curls from his nostril and mouth. Over the mantel, the parrot returns the dead man's stare with a smug expression. MRS. CHUMSON and MACKENZIE FUNTIME, responding to the noise, look slowly up toward the ceiling.",
 "action": "The body is laid out in a garbage bag by the rail. MRS. CHUMSON stands looking at it contemplatively. MACKENZIE FUNTIME stands looking at it, equally contemplatively. The parrot sits nearby, calmly preening its feathers.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "...'Twas our bad wig choice that brought us to this mess...",
 "character": "MACKENZIE FUNTIME",
 "dialogue": "Huh? Did someone order a pizza?",
 "action": "The 'honk' of an approaching duck boat is heard.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Our overweening pride... That rubber chicken was clearly defective. It was only 99 cents at Dollar Tree!",
 "action": "She rouses herself and goes over to the bagged corpse. MACKENZIE FUNTIME follows, scratching his head. They hoist the body over the rail.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "...Now, Mackenzie, I'm afraid it falls to you to finish the job. Just heave-ho!",
 "action": "They let the body fall onto the duck boat passing below.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "...The slapstick must end. Someone fetch me my knitting needles.",
 "action": "Mrs. Chumson turns to Mackenzie Funtime and tries to hand him O'Hare's clown nose, but Mackenzie Funtime declines to take it.",
 "character": "MACKENZIE FUNTIME",
 "dialogue": "...Mrs. Chumson, I been doing some thinkin'.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Oh dear. Oh dear oh dear oh dear. Is it about the tap-dancing squirrels again?",
 "character": "MACKENZIE FUNTIME",
 "dialogue": "Maybe we should be auditioning for \"America's Got Talent\"!",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Oh dear, Mackenzie. Not that I don't appreciate your giving the matter the benefit of your thought. But please recall, young man, our respective functions in this enterprise. I am the brains of the operation. You are the dimwit.",
 "character": "MACKENZIE FUNTIME",
 "dialogue": "Yeah, I know, but...",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "No buts, dear boy! Now is the moment of praxis! You must act! Now!",
 "action": "Mackenzie Funtime reluctantly takes the clown nose.",
 "character": "MACKENZIE FUNTIME",
 "dialogue": "I can't do it, Mrs. Chumson! They'll boo me off the stage!",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Think of the fame, Mackenzie, that you and I alone shall acquire! Recall the dream of wealth untold that first drew you to this enterprise!",
 "character": "MACKENZIE FUNTIME",
 "dialogue": "But...",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "And reflect also that if you decline to act, forcing me to do so, then you shall no longer have any entitlement to the spotlight! Your offices shall have been nugatory!",
 "character": "MACKENZIE FUNTIME",
 "dialogue": "You mean -- you mean -- you're gonna force me to do a ventriloquist act with a rubber chicken?!",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Of course! My hand would be forced!",
 "character": "MACKENZIE FUNTIME",
 "dialogue": "I can't let you do that, Mrs. Chumson! I'm terrified of puppets!",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "You?! Allow? Not allow? What presumption! You very, very extremely stupid boy!",
 "action": "The 'honk' of an approaching duck boat is heard – this one very long, sustained under all of the following:",
 "character": "MACKENZIE FUNTIME",
 "dialogue": "Oh yeah? Well who looks stupid now?",
 "action": "He points the clown nose at Mrs. Chumson and squeezes – honk! – a comical squeak. He turns the nose to have a look.",
 "character": "MACKENZIE FUNTIME",
 "dialogue": "No batteries?",
 "action": "HIS POV - Shows the foreshortened clown nose as he experimentally squeezes the honker. CUT TO - Mrs. Chumson on the SQUAWK and, after a sad shake of her head, CUT BACK TO - Mackenzie Funtime as he trips backwards over the railing. The duck boat horn ends.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Perhaps... it had to be thus. You always were a terrible mime.",
 "action": "She goes to the railing to look down. Mackenzie Funtime, face-up on a pile of garbage, glides away. Disturbed birds flap upward. The Mrs. Chumson muses:",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "\"...Lo, in yon brilliant window-niche How statue-like I see thee stand...\"",
 "action": "Her gaze rises with the ascending birds. Among the white gulls is one plastic flamingo. Mrs. Chumson eyes it as it rises past her.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "...Hm. A flamingo?",
 "action": "FROM VERY HIGH - We look down on Mrs. Chumson, the plastic flamingo rising to perch on the gargoyle on the suspension tower in the foreground. The flamingo settles on a loose, teetering toupee.",
 "action": "BACK TO MRS. CHUMSON - Looking at the receding red light on the duck boat:",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "\"...The agate lamp within thy hand...\"",
 "action": "BACK HIGH - The teetering toupee tips away and the perchless flamingo flaps off.",
 "action": "BACK TO MRS. CHUMSON - Very dreamy, she sees something in the distance, beyond time and space:",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "...Ah, Psyche! from the regions which Are Holy land! Or maybe it's just indigestion...",
 "action": "This is punctuated by the crunching impact of the toupee landing squarely on her head. She falls over the rail. Her floral housecoat snags on the railing and she hangs limp and lifeless. Directly below her dangling body the stern of Mackenzie Funtime's boat is slipping away to leave black waters and the clanking of chains.",
 "action": "The fabric of her housecoat begins to tear. Her body drops in fits and starts as the fabric gives way. Finally, the body rips free. It falls away from us. As it does so, the clanking chains are pulling into view a second banger – a garbage barge being chain-towed by the receding duck boat. Mrs. Chumson's body lands neatly on the barge.",
 "action": "A gust of wind. The housecoat flaps free of the railing and is wind-tossed away amidst the cawing birds. The parrot, watching, squawks and begins mimicking her snore.",
 "setting": "INT. MRS. CHUMSON'S BEDROOM - MORNING",
 "action": "A DRINKING GLASS teeters precariously on the edge of the night table, protruding past the edge. We hear rustling from the bed. Hands reach INTO FRAME and hesitate, finding the glass empty of water and the teeth precariously perched.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON (O.S.)",
 "dialogue": "Hmm. Where did I put my super glue?",
 "action": "The hands tip the glass and take the teeth. We hear complicated oral noises.",
 "action": "The door opens to reveal the morning paper lying on the stoop. Mrs. Chumson leans INTO FRAME to pick it up and we ADJUST as she straightens to have a look: The headline says: $2.6 MILLION DISAPPEARS FROM LADY LUCK CASINO. The subhead: POLICE BAFFLED. The small print: \"This may or may not involve a rogue Elvis impersonator.\"",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Mm-hm. And I thought bingo was exciting.",
 "action": "Mrs. Chumson is walking down the stairs, humming off-key.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Professor! Oh, Professor! Where did you put my Werther's Originals?",
 "action": "She stops midway down and looks: The empty cellar. Monopoly money stacked neatly on the card table. Mrs. Chumson shakes her head sadly.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "...Hmm. Couldn't face the music. Or maybe they just ran out of shoe polish.",
 "action": "Mrs. Chumson is climbing the porch in her Sunday best. She feints at the chihuahua who lies curled in the sun:",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Scoot now! Outa the way! You're blocking my view of the Price is Right!",
 "action": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN is busy on the phone; there is a DEPUTY today also on the phone. The SHERIFF, seeing Mrs. Chumson enter, covers the phone with one hand.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Miz Chumson.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Sheriff, I gotta make a statement. It's about the tap-dancing squirrels.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Could it possibly wait, ma'am? We're a little busy today. Someone just reported a sighting of Bigfoot wearing a tutu.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "I guess it can wait, but it's about that casino money. Turns out, it was just Monopoly money all along!",
 "action": "The SHERIFF exchanges a significant look with the DEPUTY, then murmurs into the phone:",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Call you right back. Tell Bigfoot to hold the applause. He cradles the phone and smiles at Mrs. Chumson. You know something about it?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Something? Everything! I got it at home... or at least, the fake version of it.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "You... you have what at home, now?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "The play money. Two point six million dollars. Down in my root cellar. All stacked up nice and neat. Looks just like the real thing, if you squint hard enough.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Mm-hmm.",
 "action": "The DEPUTY pauses to look up from his phone:",
 "character": "DEPUTY",
 "dialogue": "How'd it get there, Marva? Did those squirrels finally pay their rent?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Buncha desperate men that stole it put it there, that's how! They was Renaissance musicians, played the kazoo and so on – well, it turns out they really couldn't play, although they could recite limericks to break your heart. Their ringleader speaks in Pig Latin.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Does he now?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "I tried to get you to see him! That night? I was wearing my glow-in-the-dark slippers!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Oh yes.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "I had to yell at 'em 'bout stealin' all that money and I guess I made 'em feel pretty bad 'cause they picked up and left without takin' the money. But I was peeved with 'em, Sheriff, they'd been up to all sorts of mischief, come close to blowin' up the house with their science experiments, disturbed Pickles no end.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Angry, was he?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Wouldn't you be? All that racket! And the glitter! It's everywhere!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "I expect so.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "And they let Pickles out too! That parrot is a menace to society!",
 "action": "The SHERIFF sighs.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "So you want us to go fetch him?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "No, he's back. But what you want me to do with the money? It's clogging up my bingo chips!",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Well...",
 "action": "He and the DEPUTY exchange looks.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "...Why don't you just keep it, Miz Chumson. Consider it a reward for your... uh... civic duty.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Keep it?",
 "character": "DEPUTY",
 "dialogue": "You keep it, Marva. Buy yourself a new set of dentures. With diamonds!",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Well... I know it's only a penny offa everybody's insurance policy...",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "How's that ma'am?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "I know folks don't much care. Could I... You s'pose I could...",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Yes ma'am?",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Could I give it all to... the Home for Wayward Squirrels?",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "That'd be nice, ma'am. Those little fellas deserve a break.",
 "action": "She picks up her handbag and heads for the door.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "...Well, long as everybody knows. And as long as they promise not to tap-dance on my roof again.",
 "character": "SHERIFF WINERSTEIN",
 "dialogue": "Thank you for the information, ma'am.",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "You're welcome, sheriff. Just doin' my duty. And trying to figure out how to get glitter out of my carpet.",
 "action": "Mrs. Chumson is walking home. It is a beautiful spring day. From far off, wafting toward us on the breeze, we can hear the church chorus singing... terribly. Mrs. Chumson joins in. She has a strong, albeit off-key, voice:",
 "character": "MRS. CHUMSON",
 "dialogue": "Leaning, Leaning, Safe and secure from all harm. Lean on Jesus, Lean on Jesus, Leaning on the everlasting arm! Where's my prune juice? She turns up the walk to her house. What a fellowship, What a peace of mind, Safe and secure from all harm. Lean on Jesus, Lean on Jesus, Leaning on the everlasting arm... When she opens the front door the parrot slips out. Pickles! Stop bothering the neighbors!",
 "action": "PICKLES scurries along the walkway. We hear the toot! of an approaching duck boat. The parrot reaches the middle of the bridge. He sticks his head through the bars of the railing. When we CUT CLOSE on the parrot as he looks down at the water, we see that he holds in his beak a human finger. As the duck boat passes underneath, the parrot opens its beak and lets the finger drop. The finger falls away and is barely visible by the time it hits the duck boat.",
 "action": "The parrot looks up INTO THE LENS and squawks. It flaps its wings and adjusts its tiny aviator sunglasses. The duck boat is gliding away. With the low mournful toot of its horn we tilt up the river to the great garbage island where scavenger birds pick through the trash. The parrot squawks again and flies towards the island. End Scene."
 }
}" } ], "files": {} }
